summary: USPS faces unsustainable financial challenges. It was structured to be self-supporting but First-Class Mail volume continues to drop and it has seen operating losses for 11 straight years. After years of reduced capital spending, USPS says it has critical capital spending needs. For example, to help it meet its statutory obligation for prompt, efficient and reliable services, it plans to replace delivery vehicles—most of which...
title: U.S. Postal Service: Projected Capital Spending and Processes for Addressing Uncertainties and Risks
